intro: Dichaelia galpinii, commonly known as the Galpin's dichaelia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 meter. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
